decks.notes: This UW Control deck focuses on countering opponent's spells and controlling the board with removal spells like Day of Judgment, Get Lost, and No More Lies. It also includes card advantage engines like Stock Up and Meticulous Archive to outvalue opponents over the long game. The deck includes powerful finishers like Elspeth, Storm Slayer and Marang River Regent to close out the game once control is established. Overlord of the Mistmoors provides additional protection and disruption, while Beza, the Bounding Spring provides early game pressure. The mana base is focused on ensuring consistent access to both white and blue mana sources.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and quick creature drops. It focuses on exploiting the opponent's hand with cards like Duress, while also utilizing removal spells like Go for the Throat to control the board. The main win condition comes from powerful creatures like Archfiend of the Dross and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The deck also includes some land destruction options with cards like Legions to Ashes and is designed to maintain constant pressure on the opponent with a mix of creatures and spell-based disruption.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly deploy aggressive creatures like Magebane Lizard and Voice of Victory, along with powerful removal spells like Lightning Helix and Burst Lightning, to apply early pressure on the opponent. The deck also has a strong finisher in Elspeth, Storm Slayer and can generate additional value with cards like Bruse Tarl, Roving Rancher and Screaming Nemesis. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy by ensuring consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, aiming to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The deck includes a mix of cheap creatures like Emberheart Challenger and Hired Claw, along with burn spells like Burst Lightning and Scorching Shot. The goal is to establish board presence early and continuously pressure the opponent while also using cards like Monstrous Rage and Witchstalker Frenzy to maximize damage output. The deck is built to be fast-paced and proactive, aiming to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This aggressive mono-black deck focuses on quick creature removal, card disruption, and building up a strong board presence with powerful creatures like Elenda, Archfiend of the Dross, and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration and card draw to maintain pressure on the opponent. Overall, the strategy is to control the board early on, disrupt the opponent's resources, and overwhelm them with high-impact creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle using cheap and efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Drake Hatcher. The deck also utilizes burn spells like Torch the Tower and Monstrous Rage to clear the way for its creatures to attack. With card draw and filtering spells like Sleight of Hand and Opt, the deck aims to maintain a consistent and aggressive presence on the board. The inclusion of cards like This Town Ain't Big Enough and Thundertrap Trainer add additional utility and versatility to the deck's game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent. By utilizing low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Drake Hatcher along with spells like Monstrous Rage and Stormchaser's Talent, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to establish a solid defense. The deck also includes cards like Opt and Sleight of Hand to help maintain card advantage and find key pieces. Overall, the strategy of this deck revolves around fast-paced aggression and efficient spellcasting to secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on using low-cost creatures and burn spells to deal damage quickly and efficiently. It utilizes spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage to control the board and push for aggressive damage with creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter. The goal is to keep the pressure on the opponent and overwhelm them with a mix of creature damage and direct burn spells. The deck aims to win the game before the opponent can stabilize and mount a defense.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of disruptive spells and aggressive creatures to control the board and overwhelm the opponent quickly. By playing cards like Spyglass Siren and Floodpits Drowner, the deck is able to put pressure on the opponent while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Duress and Go for the Throat. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to seal the deal. Overall, the deck aims to be fast, aggressive, and disruptive to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures while disrupting their strategy with hand disruption and removal spells. The key strategy is to maintain board presence through efficient creatures like Preacher of the Schism and Spyglass Siren, while using spells like Duress and Cut Down to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to close out games swiftly. The mana base is designed to support a smooth curve of plays and ensure the deck can consistently apply pressure.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm your opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter alongside Burst Lightning and Torch the Tower, you can deal damage quickly and efficiently. Stock Up and Opt help you dig for more threats and answers, while cards like Drake Hatcher and Thundertrap Trainer provide additional creatures to apply pressure. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive nature of the deck, allowing for a smooth curve of spells to keep the pressure on your opponent.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and removal spells to control the board and push through damage quickly. By combining powerful creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Spyglass Siren with efficient removal like Cut Down and Go for the Throat, the deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. Additionally, the inclusion of Enduring Curiosity allows for card draw to keep the aggression going. The mana base is built around supporting the deck's color requirements to ensure smooth gameplay.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck focuses on playing low-cost creatures like Cori-Steel Cutter and Drake Hatcher, and using cards like Burst Lightning, Torch the Tower, and Monstrous Rage to deal direct damage to the opponent. Stock Up and Opt help to draw cards and dig for more threats, while Sleight of Hand and Stormchaser's Talent provide additional card selection and damage. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive game plan and allow for consistent plays.

The main focus of this Red Deck Wins aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent. The deck includes a mix of efficient creatures and burn spells to put pressure on the opponent and control the board. With cards like Heartfire Hero, Lightning Strike, and Burst Lightning, the deck aims to finish off the opponent before they can stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Soulstone Sanctuary and Witchstalker Frenzy provide additional support and resilience to keep the pressure up.

The deck revolves around assembling the Omniscience Combo to achieve a powerful win condition. It focuses on generating card advantage, controlling the board with lockdown spells, and searching for key cards like Roiling Dragonstorm and Overlord of the Floodpits. Utilizing various mana sources and protection spells like Spell Pierce, the deck aims to cast multiple spells for free with Omniscience in play, overwhelming the opponent with a lethal combo finish. The synergy between card draw, mana acceleration, and combo pieces is key to the deck's success in a Standard 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on fast, aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It includes removal spells like Go for the Throat and Cut Down to clear the way for powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Kitsa, Otterball Elite. The spell Proft's Eidetic Memory helps to draw more cards and maintain pressure on the opponent. The land base is primarily focused on producing black mana to ensure all spells can be cast efficiently. Overall, the deck aims to establish an early board presence and quickly close out games before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.
